caption.title: Deaths averted among 1–59-month-old children following measles campaign launch, India.

fn.p: Data are ordinary least-squares regressions models adjusted for time fixed effects and time interactions. The expected rates were extrapolated by extending the pre-intervention trend to the end of the time series and then applied to the estimated UN live births at 2013 to estimate the potential magnitude of the intervention effects. National estimates are derived from the summation of stratified models. The range represents the upper and lower bounds on the basis of one or more physician coding including family reporting the child to have a history of measles (using the local language term) and only one or more physician coding, respectively.
